extracted_information: The U.S. Department of Labor's Office of Foreign Labor Certification (OFLC) provides downloadable Labor Condition Application (LCA) disclosure data files. These files are available in Microsoft Excel (.xlsx) format, which is a machine-readable format. Corresponding PDF documents, known as 'Program Record Layouts,' are provided for each dataset, detailing the specific fields and their descriptions. These layouts are crucial for understanding the exact information contained, including details like job titles, salary information, and company names, although personally identifiable information (PII) such as Federal Employer Identification Numbers (FEIN), attorney state bar numbers, and foreign worker names/addresses are excluded. Open text fields with large character limits, such as 'job duties,' may also be difficult to extract into a user-friendly format in the data sets.

specifications.data_source: Selected information extracted from nonimmigrant and immigrant application tables within OFLC's case management systems, provided by employers and system-generated metadata.
excluded_data: Personally Identifiable Information (PII) such as Federal Employer Identification Numbers (FEIN)
Open text fields with very large character limits that are difficult to extract (e.g., job duties, statement of temporary need)

features.name: Downloadable Data Files
features.description: Comprehensive LCA disclosure data for H-1B, H-1B1, and E-3 programs.

features.name: Program Record Layouts
features.description: PDF documents detailing each field title and description within the corresponding data sets.

features.name: Employer Information
features.description: Data includes information provided by employers, implicitly including company names.

features.name: Salary Information
features.description: Implied through mentions of 'Average Wage Offer / AEWR' in summary statistics, indicating salary/wage data is present in detailed files.

temporal_info.historical_data_availability: Available for prior fiscal years, starting from FY 2008 for LCA programs. Some earlier data is also mentioned (e.g., prevailing wage from 2010).

references.description: Foreign Labor Certification Data Center website for additional historical data
